chapter_metadata.subject: History
chapter_metadata.chapter_name: Last Phase of Struggle of Independence

questions.question: Which movement marked the final mass struggle against British rule?
questions.answer: Quit India Movement

questions.question: In which year was the Quit India Movement launched?
Who gave the slogan 'Do or Die'?
questions.answer: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.question: Which organization formed the Indian National Army (INA)?
questions.answer: Azad Hind Government

questions.question: Who led the Indian National Army?
questions.answer: Subhas Chandra Bose

questions.question: What was the aim of the Quit India Movement?
questions.answer: Immediate independence

questions.question: Which event weakened British control after World War II?
questions.answer: INA trials

questions.question: Which naval revolt occurred in 1946?
questions.answer: Royal Indian Navy Mutiny

questions.question: Which plan proposed the transfer of power in 1947?
questions.answer: Mountbatten Plan

questions.answer: Quit India Movement

questions.question: In which year was the Quit India Movement launched?
Who gave the slogan 'Do or Die'?
questions.answer: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.question: Which organization formed the Indian National Army (INA)?
questions.answer: Azad Hind Government

questions.question: Who led the Indian National Army?
questions.answer: Subhas Chandra Bose

questions.question: What was the aim of the Quit India Movement?
questions.answer: Immediate independence

questions.question: Which event weakened British control after World War II?
questions.answer: INA trials

questions.answer: Royal Indian Navy Mutiny

questions.question: Which plan proposed the transfer of power in 1947?
questions.answer: Mountbatten Plan

questions.question: India became independent in which year?
What was the Quit India Movement?
questions.answer: It was a mass movement launched in 1942 demanding immediate independence from British rule.

questions.question: What is the significance of the slogan 'Do or Die'?
questions.answer: It urged Indians to make a final effort for freedom, even at great sacrifice.

questions.question: Who was Subhas Chandra Bose?
questions.answer: He was a nationalist leader who led the Indian National Army to fight British rule.

questions.question: Why were the INA trials important?
questions.answer: They aroused national feelings and weakened British authority.

questions.question: How did World War II affect the freedom struggle?
questions.answer: It weakened Britain economically and politically, accelerating independence.
